jobs.title: Delivery Operations Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Distyl AI

Distyl AI develops production-grade AI systems to power core operational workflows for Fortune 500 companies. Powered by a strategic partnership with OpenAI, in-house software accelerators, and deep enterprise AI expertise, we deliver working AI systems with rapid time to value – within a quarter.

Our products have helped Fortune 500 customers across diverse industries, from insurance and CPG to non-profits. As part of our team, you will help companies identify, build, and realize value from their GenAI investments, often for the first time. We are customer-centric, working backward from the customer’s problem and holding ourselves accountable for creating both financial impact and improving the lives of end-users.

Distyl is led by proven leaders from top companies like Palantir and Apple and is backed by Lightspeed, Khosla, Coatue, Dell Technologies Capital, Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), Brad Gerstner (Founder and CEO of Altimeter), and board members of over a dozen Fortune 500 companies.

What We Are Looking For

As the Delivery Operations Manager, you’ll be the operational backbone that keeps projects on time, on budget, and staffed with the right people. You’ll own our operating cadence, data integrity across PSA and CRM systems, and the analytics that guide decisions. You’ll partner closely with Finance and Sales to translate bookings into predictable delivery and revenue.

Key Responsibilities

  • Operational Cadence & Forecasting

    • Run the weekly Delivery business rhythm (forecast reviews, staffing standups, at‑risk project reviews, and backlog health).

    • Maintain a rolling 13‑week delivery and revenue forecast; track variance to plan and drive corrective actions.

    • Build and maintain dashboards for utilization, margin, delivery status, and capacity.

    Project Financials & Controls

    • Establish & monitor project P&L (budget vs. actuals, gross margin, burn rate, change orders, billing milestones).

    • Partner with Finance on revenue recognition readiness (T&M vs. fixed fee), WIP, backlog, and DSO impacts.

    • Ensure accurate and timely time entry, expense submission, and milestone completion for invoicing.

    Resource & Capacity Management

    • Own supply/demand planning, role forecasting, and staffing requests across projects and pre‑sales.

    • Track utilization (billable, productive, and bench) and recommend hiring or contractor backfills.

    • Maintain skills inventory and help route the right resources to the right work.

    Systems, Data, & Tooling

    • Setup initial PSA system

    • Ensure data accuracy and process compliance in our PSA and CRM

    • Define and enforce a services data dictionary (project stages, fields, picklists, SLAs).

    • Build automation and QA checks to improve data completeness and reduce manual work.

    Cross‑Functional Liaison (Finance & Sales)

    • Translate SOWs into deliverable work plans with budgets, schedules, and resourcing assumptions.

    • Partner with Sales Ops to ensure opportunity handoff completeness and clean project creation.

    • Align with Finance on billing cadence, revenue policies, and margin targets; escalate risks early.

    Playbooks & Enablement

    • Create and maintain process documentation (intake, staffing, project setup/closeout, change control).

    • Standardize SOW templates, project plans, and reporting packs.

    • Train PMs/consultants on operational best practices and system workflows.

    Continuous Improvement

    • Analyze trends to reduce delivery risk and improve throughput (scope creep, blockers, rework).

    • Lead pilots for new tools or process changes; measure impact and scale what works.

Qualifications

  • 4+ years in Delivery Operations, PS Operations, Consulting Operations, or Revenue/Services Ops at a SaaS, PaaS, or services org.

  • Proficiency with Salesforce and PSAs; comfort administering objects, reports, and workflows.

  • Strong analytical skills; expert in spreadsheets; familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and basic SQL a plus.

  • Understanding of project accounting (fixed fee vs. T&M, margin, WIP, backlog, DSO, rev‑rec readiness).

  • Process design and change management chops; able to turn ambiguity into standard operating procedures.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management; comfortable influencing without authority.

  • High attention to detail, ownership mindset, and bias for action.

Nice to Have

  • Experience launching or restructuring PSA processes during high growth.

  • Prior hands‑on PM/consulting experience on enterprise projects.

  • Familiarity with AI/ML or data platform implementations.

  • CRM/PSA: Salesforce; FinancialForce/Certinia PSA.

  • Productivity & PM: Google Workspace; Jira/Asana; Confluence/Notion.

Analytics: Looker or Tableau; Google Sheets/Excel.

What is success like in the first 12 Months

  • Forecast Accuracy: Delivery/revenue forecast within ±5–10% of actuals by quarter.

  • Utilization: Team at or above target billable utilization with healthy bench management.

  • Margin: Project gross margin meets or exceeds plan; risks flagged ≥4 weeks ahead.

  • On‑Time Delivery: ≥90% of projects delivered on or before committed date.

  • Data Quality: PSA/SFDC data completeness ≥95% across key fields.

  • Cash Flow: Reduced DSO (where services‑influenced) and timely billing milestones.

    What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options and healthcare.

  • The opportunity to work at a mission-driven AI startup that is transforming how Fortune 500 companies operate.

  • A fast-paced, dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact the company’s success.

  • A collaborative culture that values professional growth and encourages taking on new responsibilities.

  • Exposure to cutting-edge AI technologies and the opportunity to support a world-class team.

If you are a proactive, detail-oriented professional who excels in supporting high-powered teams, we encourage you to apply and join our mission of enabling the future of AI-powered enterprises.

Note: This role will be based in our San Francisco office. You will be required to be in office 3 days per week.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
About Distyl AI

Distyl AI develops production-grade AI systems to power core operational workflows for Fortune 500 companies. Powered by a strategic partnership with OpenAI, in-house software accelerators, and deep enterprise AI expertise, we deliver working AI systems with rapid time to value – within a quarter.

Our products have helped Fortune 500 customers across diverse industries, from insurance and CPG to non-profits. As part of our team, you will help companies identify, build, and realize value from their GenAI investments, often for the first time. We are customer-centric, working backward from the customer’s problem and holding ourselves accountable for creating both financial impact and improving the lives of end-users.

Distyl is led by proven leaders from top companies like Palantir and Apple and is backed by Lightspeed, Khosla, Coatue, Dell Technologies Capital, Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), Brad Gerstner (Founder and CEO of Altimeter), and board members of over a dozen Fortune 500 companies.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

As the Delivery Operations Manager, you’ll be the operational backbone that keeps projects on time, on budget, and staffed with the right people. You’ll own our operating cadence, data integrity across PSA and CRM systems, and the analytics that guide decisions. You’ll partner closely with Finance and Sales to translate bookings into predictable delivery and revenue.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Operational Cadence & Forecasting
   
   - Run the weekly Delivery business rhythm (forecast reviews, staffing standups, at‑risk project reviews, and backlog health).
   
   - Maintain a rolling 13‑week delivery and revenue forecast; track variance to plan and drive corrective actions.
   
   - Build and maintain dashboards for utilization, margin, delivery status, and capacity.
   
   Project Financials & Controls
   
   - Establish & monitor project P&L (budget vs. actuals, gross margin, burn rate, change orders, billing milestones).
   
   - Partner with Finance on revenue recognition readiness (T&M vs. fixed fee), WIP, backlog, and DSO impacts.
   
   - Ensure accurate and timely time entry, expense submission, and milestone completion for invoicing.
   
   Resource & Capacity Management
   
   - Own supply/demand planning, role forecasting, and staffing requests across projects and pre‑sales.
   
   - Track utilization (billable, productive, and bench) and recommend hiring or contractor backfills.
   
   - Maintain skills inventory and help route the right resources to the right work.
   
   Systems, Data, & Tooling
   
   - Setup initial PSA system
   
   - Ensure data accuracy and process compliance in our PSA and CRM
   
   - Define and enforce a services data dictionary (project stages, fields, picklists, SLAs).
   
   - Build automation and QA checks to improve data completeness and reduce manual work.
   
   Cross‑Functional Liaison (Finance & Sales)
   
   - Translate SOWs into deliverable work plans with budgets, schedules, and resourcing assumptions.
   
   - Partner with Sales Ops to ensure opportunity handoff completeness and clean project creation.
   
   - Align with Finance on billing cadence, revenue policies, and margin targets; escalate risks early.
   
   Playbooks & Enablement
   
   - Create and maintain process documentation (intake, staffing, project setup/closeout, change control).
   
   - Standardize SOW templates, project plans, and reporting packs.
   
   - Train PMs/consultants on operational best practices and system workflows.
   
   Continuous Improvement
   
   - Analyze trends to reduce delivery risk and improve throughput (scope creep, blockers, rework).
   
   - Lead pilots for new tools or process changes; measure impact and scale what works.


QUALIFICATIONS

 - 4+ years in Delivery Operations, PS Operations, Consulting Operations, or Revenue/Services Ops at a SaaS, PaaS, or services org.

 - Proficiency with Salesforce and PSAs; comfort administering objects, reports, and workflows.

 - Strong analytical skills; expert in spreadsheets; familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and basic SQL a plus.

 - Understanding of project accounting (fixed fee vs. T&M, margin, WIP, backlog, DSO, rev‑rec readiness).

 - Process design and change management chops; able to turn ambiguity into standard operating procedures.

 - Excellent communication and stakeholder management; comfortable influencing without authority.

 - High attention to detail, ownership mindset, and bias for action.
   


NICE TO HAVE

 - Experience launching or restructuring PSA processes during high growth.

 - Prior hands‑on PM/consulting experience on enterprise projects.

 - Familiarity with AI/ML or data platform implementations.

 - CRM/PSA: Salesforce; FinancialForce/Certinia PSA.

 - Productivity & PM: Google Workspace; Jira/Asana; Confluence/Notion.

Analytics: Looker or Tableau; Google Sheets/Excel.


WHAT IS SUCCESS LIKE IN THE FIRST 12 MONTHS

 - Forecast Accuracy: Delivery/revenue forecast within ±5–10% of actuals by quarter.

 - Utilization: Team at or above target billable utilization with healthy bench management.

 - Margin: Project gross margin meets or exceeds plan; risks flagged ≥4 weeks ahead.

 - On‑Time Delivery: ≥90% of projects delivered on or before committed date.

 - Data Quality: PSA/SFDC data completeness ≥95% across key fields.

 - Cash Flow: Reduced DSO (where services‑influenced) and timely billing milestones.
   
   
   WHAT WE OFFER:

 - Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options and healthcare.

 - The opportunity to work at a mission-driven AI startup that is transforming how Fortune 500 companies operate.

 - A fast-paced, dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact the company’s success.

 - A collaborative culture that values professional growth and encourages taking on new responsibilities.

 - Exposure to cutting-edge AI technologies and the opportunity to support a world-class team.

If you are a proactive, detail-oriented professional who excels in supporting high-powered teams, we encourage you to apply and join our mission of enabling the future of AI-powered enterprises.

Note: This role will be based in our San Francisco office. You will be required to be in office 3 days per week.

jobs.title: Applied AI Researcher, Benchmarking
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Distyl AI develops AI native technologies for humans & AI to collaborate to power the operations of the Global Fortune 1000.

In just 24 months, we’ve rapidly grown to partner with some of the world’s largest enterprises—including F100 telecom, healthcare, manufacturing, insurance, and retail companies—delivering multiple AI deployments with $100M+ impact. Our platform, Distillery, along with our team of AI Engineers, Researchers, and Strategists, is pioneering AI-native systems of work, solving the most complex, high-stakes challenges at scale.

Distyl is founded and led by proven leaders from companies like Palantir, Apple, and top national laboratories. We work in deep partnership with OpenAI, jointly going-to-market at the largest enterprises and collaborating evaluating and testing the latest models. Backed by Lightspeed, Khosla, Coatue, industry leaders like Nat Friedman (former GitHub CEO), as well as board members of over 20+ F500s, Distyl is building the future of AI-powered enterprise operations.

What We Are Looking For

At Distyl we’re pushing the envelope of AI utilization in enterprise. This requires creative researchers who don’t just want to drive incremental improvements on benchmarks or optimize an existing process but instead are looking to creatively redefine how software is used.

Our researchers come from many academic backgrounds but have strong research track records, operate in an AI-native way, and would be bored staying on the rails of a traditional research org.

Key Responsibilities

  • The Benchmarking team defines how progress is measured. Researchers design evaluation frameworks that capture reasoning depth, interaction quality, reliability, and operational impact. They construct benchmarks that reflect real-world complexity. Their systems become the standard by which new architectures, techniques, and releases are judged.

  • Researchers in Benchmarking explore new paradigms for evaluating intelligent systems: adversarial robustness testing, longitudinal performance tracking, and human-in-the-loop assessment. They investigate how metrics shape model behavior and establish rigorous methodologies for quantifying emergent capability. Their insights drive both Distyl’s internal research priorities and industry-wide standards.

What We Require

  • Experience Designing and Running Evaluations: You’ve built or maintained benchmarks, test suites, or experimental frameworks to measure model or system performance.

  • Statistical and Analytical Rigor: You design fair, reproducible experiments and can extract signal from noisy empirical results.

  • Experience Building with Models, Not Just Building Models: We develop intelligent systems using models rather than training or fine-tuning them. Ideal candidates have expertise in compound AI systems, agentic collaboration, and associated techniques (ensembling, ReAct, graph-of-thoughts, etc.).

  • Proven Track Record of Research Results: Whether you’ve published in top journals, posted amazing work on twitter, or somewhere else we want to see what you've done.

  • Uses AI Every Day: Before you can revolutionize someone else’s workflow, you need to revolutionize yours. You should be using tools like ChatGPT, Cursor, and Perplexity to accelerate your workflow.

  • Strong Programming and Data Analysis Skills: While you might not consider yourself a software engineer you need to be able to build prototypes of your ideas and then perform the experiments to prove the effectiveness to a F500 Head of AI.

  • Biases Towards Showing vs Telling: Our customers want to see the power of AI today vs discuss the most elegant idea that will take 5 years to realize.

What We Offer

  • An opportunity to advance the cutting edge of LLM research and directly revolutionize work in the enterprise space.

  • Ownership of high-impact research projects, with the autonomy to explore novel approaches and solutions.

  • Access to state-of-the-art AI models, real business problems, and proprietary data sets across a diverse range of real-world industries.

  • Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options, medical/dental/vision covered at 100% for you and your dependents, 401K plan, and perks such as commuter benefits and lunch provided in office.

  • Be part of a mission-oriented company to create practical adoption during the biggest revolution in human productivity.

  • A collaborative and intellectually stimulating environment that encourages innovation and personal growth.

If you are an innovative, ambitious, and driven individual looking to make a difference in the world of AI, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team as an Applied AI Researcher and help us shape the future of AI-driven solutions for enterprises across the globe.

Note: Distyl is a hybrid working environment and requires in office collaboration 3 days a week. We have offices in SF and NYC

jobs.title: Head of Finance
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Distyl

Distyl partners with the Global Fortune 1000 to lead $100M+ transformations through AI-native automation of core operations. Backed by Lightspeed, Khosla, and Coatue, we operate like a special ops team: fast, outcome-driven, and focused on solving high-stakes enterprise challenges. Our team blends elite talent from tech, strategy, and government to build the future of AI-powered enterprise operations.

About the Role

We’re hiring a Head of Finance to build and scale the finance function from the ground up.

This is both a strategic and hands-on role, you’ll set up systems, processes, and models while serving as a key thought partner to the CEO and leadership team.

You’ll own the full finance stack, from operating rhythm (budgeting, forecasting, cash management, and reporting) to strategic finance (fundraising, capital planning, and scenario modeling). You’ll build and lead a small team across FP&A, accounting, and operations to create the financial infrastructure for scale.

This is a high-impact role for a finance leader who thrives in fast-moving environments, is comfortable with ambiguity, and wants to help shape the trajectory of a high-growth AI company.

What You’ll Do

  • Build and lead Distyl’s finance function, including FP&A, accounting, and reporting from the ground up.

  • Partner closely with the COO and leadership team across Operations, Growth, and Engineering to inform key business decisions.

  • Develop financial models, forecasts, and frameworks to guide hiring, pricing, and investment decisions.

  • Create scalable processes for budget discipline, expense management, and financial accountability.

  • Lead and manage fundraising preparation, owning investor materials, scenario modeling, and due diligence readiness.

  • Design and manage monthly and quarterly close processes in partnership with external accounting firms.

  • Deliver clear, actionable financial reporting and insights for executives, the board, and investors.

  • Oversee treasury, cash management, and capital allocation to ensure financial sustainability and strategic growth.

  • Build, coach, and develop a small finance team as the company scales.

Who You Are

  • 10–15 years of progressive experience in finance, ideally across FP&A, strategic finance, and accounting.

  • Experience in high-growth technology or AI companies, with time spent leading or building finance functions.

  • Background in investment banking, consulting, private equity, or corporate FP&A.

  • Strong analytical and modeling skills, able to translate complex data into clear insights and strategic actions.

  • Excellent communicator with the ability to influence executive and board-level discussions.

  • Hands-on, pragmatic operator who builds for scale but isn’t afraid to dive into the details.

  • Experience leading and growing small, high-performing teams.

  • Prior fundraising, investor reporting, or M&A experience preferred.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options and healthcare.

  • The opportunity to work at a mission-driven AI startup that is transforming how Fortune 500 companies operate.

  • A fast-paced, dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact the company’s success.

  • A collaborative culture that values professional growth and encourages taking on new responsibilities.

Note: Distyl is a hybrid working environment and requires in-office collaboration 3 days a week. We have offices in San Francisco, CA and New York, NY, and this role is available in San Francisco office.

jobs.title: Campus Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Distyl AI:

Distyl AI develops AI-native technologies for humans & AI to collaborate to power the operations of the Global Fortune 500.

In just over 24 months, we’ve rapidly grown to partner with some of the world’s largest enterprises—including F100 telecom, healthcare, manufacturing, insurance, and retail companies—delivering multiple AI deployments with $100M+ impact. Our platform, Distillery, along with our team of AI Engineers, Researchers, and Strategists, is pioneering AI-native systems of work, solving the most complex, high-stakes challenges at scale.

Distyl is founded and led by proven leaders from companies like Palantir, Apple, and top national laboratories. We work in deep partnership with OpenAI, jointly going-to-market at the largest enterprises and collaborating, evaluating, and testing the latest models. Backed by Lightspeed, Khosla, Coatue, industry leaders like Nat Friedman (former GitHub CEO), and board members of over 20+ F500s, Distyl is building the future of AI-powered enterprise operations.

What We Are Looking For

Distyl is looking for a dynamic and relationship-driven Campus Recruiter to build and scale our university recruiting program. In this role, you’ll design and execute a comprehensive strategy to attract exceptional early-career talent from top universities and programs. The ideal candidate thrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments and has a strong track record of managing university partnerships, career fairs, and early talent pipelines end to end. You’ll bring creativity, organization, and strong communication skills to ensure that Distyl becomes a top destination for emerging talent in AI, engineering, research and strategy.

Key Responsibilities

Design and lead Distyl’s campus recruiting strategy by building strong partnerships with top universities and student organizations across technical and business disciplines.

Plan and execute all campus events including career fairs, information sessions, hackathons, and networking events, managing logistics, coordination, and on-the-ground representation.

Develop scalable early talent programs such as internship pipelines, new graduate hiring tracks, and rotational programs.

Partner closely with hiring managers to identify early talent needs, align on role profiles, and deliver diverse, high-quality candidate pipelines.

Deliver exceptional candidate experiences ensuring clear communication, timely feedback, and a positive reflection of Distyl’s culture and values.

Leverage data and recruiting tools (including AI-driven platforms) to track performance metrics, improve engagement, and continuously optimize the campus recruiting process.

Champion Distyl’s employer brand across campuses through social media, partnerships, and thought leadership in university ecosystems.

What We’re Looking For

  • 5 years of experience in campus or university recruiting with a demonstrated ability to build and manage recruiting programs from the ground up.

  • Willingness to up travel 30% to universities and events outside of New York City as needed throughout the academic year.

  • Proven success working with top universities and early talent programs, ideally within tech, consulting, or high-growth environments.

  • Strong project management skills, highly organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable running multiple events and programs simultaneously.

  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills with a genuine enthusiasm for engaging with students, faculty, and career services partners.

  • Ability to use recruiting tools (e.g., Ashby, Gem, Handshake, LinkedIn) to source, manage pipelines, and analyze recruiting data.

  • A proactive, collaborative mindset, comfortable operating autonomously while partnering closely with internal stakeholders.

  • Passion for building inclusive and scalable early talent strategies that reflect Distyl’s values and long-term vision.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options and healthcare.

  • The opportunity to work at a mission-driven AI startup that is transforming how Fortune 500 companies operate.

  • A fast-paced, dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact the company’s success.

  • A collaborative culture that values professional growth and encourages taking on new responsibilities.

  • Exposure to cutting-edge AI technologies and the opportunity to build a world-class team.

  • If you are a proactive, detail-oriented professional who excels in supporting high-powered teams, we encourage you to apply and join our mission of enabling the future of AI-powered enterprises.


Note: Distyl is a hybrid working environment and requires in-office collaboration 3 days per week in one of our offices. We have offices in New York City and San Francisco.

What We Are Looking For

Distyl is seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to the Co-Founder, COO to provide critical operational and administrative support. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, operates with precision, and demonstrates exceptional judgment and discretion.

You will be instrumental in optimizing the COO’s time, managing communications and priorities, and ensuring seamless execution across operational, strategic, and administrative initiatives. This position requires someone who is detail-oriented, adaptable, and capable of anticipating needs to help the COO operate at maximum effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities

Executive Support

  • Manage the COO’s complex and dynamic calendar, ensuring alignment with business priorities and operational timelines.

  • Coordinate meetings, briefings, and cross-functional sessions, including preparing materials, agendas, and follow-up actions.

  • Arrange domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, itineraries, and expense reporting.

  • Serve as a primary liaison for internal and external communications, maintaining professionalism, confidentiality, and strong relationship management

Operational & Administrative Support

  • Act as a strategic partner to the COO by driving prioritization, focus, and alignment across key initiatives.

  • Build and optimize systems that improve operational excellence, communication, and execution.

  • Track strategic priorities, surface blockers, and ensure follow-through across teams.

  • Anticipate needs and provide leverage through effective time management and preparation.

  • Synthesize insights from multiple workstreams to continuously help the COO focus on the highest-impact areas.

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience supporting a C-level executive, ideally in a startup, operations, or high-growth environment.

  • Proven ability to manage complex schedules, competing priorities, and highly confidential information with discretion.

  • Strong organizational and project management skills with meticulous attention to detail.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage professionally across all levels of the organization.

  • Highly resourceful and proactive, with the ability to anticipate needs and stay several steps ahead.

  • Tech-savvy and comfortable using tools such as G Suite, Slack, Notion, project management platforms, and expense systems.

  • Calm under pressure, adaptable to shifting priorities, and solutions-oriented.

  • Based in New York City, with flexibility for occasional travel to company offsites, meetings, or events.

What We Offer

jobs.descriptionPlain:
ABOUT DISTYL AI:

Distyl AI develops AI-native technologies for humans & AI to collaborate to power the operations of the Global Fortune 500.

In just over 24 months, we’ve rapidly grown to partner with some of the world’s largest enterprises—including F100 telecom, healthcare, manufacturing, insurance, and retail companies—delivering multiple AI deployments with $100M+ impact. Our platform, Distillery, along with our team of AI Engineers, Researchers, and Strategists, is pioneering AI-native systems of work, solving the most complex, high-stakes challenges at scale.

Distyl is founded and led by proven leaders from companies like Palantir, Apple, and top national laboratories. We work in deep partnership with OpenAI, jointly going-to-market at the largest enterprises and collaborating, evaluating, and testing the latest models. Backed by Lightspeed, Khosla, Coatue, industry leaders like Nat Friedman (former GitHub CEO), and board members of over 20+ F500s, Distyl is building the future of AI-powered enterprise operations.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Distyl is seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to the Co-Founder, COO to provide critical operational and administrative support. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, operates with precision, and demonstrates exceptional judgment and discretion.

You will be instrumental in optimizing the COO’s time, managing communications and priorities, and ensuring seamless execution across operational, strategic, and administrative initiatives. This position requires someone who is detail-oriented, adaptable, and capable of anticipating needs to help the COO operate at maximum effectiveness.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Executive Support

 - Manage the COO’s complex and dynamic calendar, ensuring alignment with business priorities and operational timelines.

 - Coordinate meetings, briefings, and cross-functional sessions, including preparing materials, agendas, and follow-up actions.

 - Arrange domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, itineraries, and expense reporting.

 - Serve as a primary liaison for internal and external communications, maintaining professionalism, confidentiality, and strong relationship management

Operational & Administrative Support

 - Act as a strategic partner to the COO by driving prioritization, focus, and alignment across key initiatives.

 - Build and optimize systems that improve operational excellence, communication, and execution.

 - Track strategic priorities, surface blockers, and ensure follow-through across teams.

 - Anticipate needs and provide leverage through effective time management and preparation.

 - Synthesize insights from multiple workstreams to continuously help the COO focus on the highest-impact areas.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - 5+ years of experience supporting a C-level executive, ideally in a startup, operations, or high-growth environment.

 - Proven ability to manage complex schedules, competing priorities, and highly confidential information with discretion.

 - Strong organizational and project management skills with meticulous attention to detail.

 - Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage professionally across all levels of the organization.

 - Highly resourceful and proactive, with the ability to anticipate needs and stay several steps ahead.

 - Tech-savvy and comfortable using tools such as G Suite, Slack, Notion, project management platforms, and expense systems.

 - Calm under pressure, adaptable to shifting priorities, and solutions-oriented.

 - Based in New York City, with flexibility for occasional travel to company offsites, meetings, or events.


WHAT WE OFFER

 - Competitive salary and benefits package, including equity options and healthcare.

 - The opportunity to work at a mission-driven AI startup that is transforming how Fortune 500 companies operate.

 - A fast-paced, dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact the company’s success.

 - A collaborative culture that values professional growth and encourages taking on new responsibilities.

 - Exposure to cutting-edge AI technologies and the opportunity to build a world-class team.

 - If you are a proactive, detail-oriented professional who excels in supporting high-powered teams, we encourage you to apply and join our mission of enabling the future of AI-powered enterprises.




Note: Distyl is a hybrid working environment and requires in-office collaboration 3 days per week in one of our offices. We have offices in New York City and San Francisco.
